intro: Orchis praetermissa subsp. integrata, commonly known as the purple marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wet meadows and marshy areas in Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces striking violet to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant has a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and a single, erect flowering stem. Its flowers are characterized by a spurred lip and are arranged in a loose spike. The species is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor, waterlogged soils.
